title: HAMRVL Led Dimmer Switch DC 12V Touch Switch On/Off Dimmer Stepless Dimming Switches as 5-24V LED Lights Strip Brightness Controller Suitable for 17mm/0.67in Mounting Hole(Touch dimmer A)

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #79,709 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #160 in Dimmer Switches       #160 in Dimmer Switches

feature_bullets: This dimmer switch is often used as DC1 2V switch,also can be as a led dimmer switch for led lights from 5V to 24V.Pls make sure your driver is a constant voltage driver since this dimmer switches can be connected to constant voltage driver only.And This led dimmer switch must cannot be connected to the constant current driver.You can check the picture to see the difference between the constant voltage driver and constant current driver.

Touch sensor switch/dimmer knob for 12 volt led lights, just touch it. For This DC 12 volt dimmer switch,just Short press to turn on and off the led lights slowly, Long press to stepless dimming and control your light.It has memory funtion.When you turn on the light again,the light brightness will be the same as last time automatically. Pls confirm your diver is a constant voltage driver.This led dimmer must can not connect to a constant current.Can check the picture to see the details.

This led dimmer switch for led lights is recessed installation.The whole size is 17mm/0.67in.JUST a small touch sensor dimmer switches for led lights .It won't take up much place.You can use it in for your interior lights as a lamp dimmer switch.Or you can use it for your camper light switch.In this way,You can adjust the light to a very low brightness in the dark night instead of turn off the lamp.

This Dimming light Switch, maximum pwer 5V15W、12V36W、24V72W.It normally is used to control the led light. Don't exceed the rating amps and volts, you can run it on your other projects such as mirror as your good customer recommended.
This dc dimmable light switch Often used as 12v switch and led strip dimmer for Cabinet,kitchen,Wine cabinet,Showcase,wardrobe etc

customers_say: Customers find the dimmer switch easy to install and appreciate its appearance, particularly its color. The functionality receives mixed feedback - while some say it works great, others report it failing within days. The dimming ability and control features also get mixed reviews, with some praising the dimming capability while others mention it won't dim or turn off, and several customers report issues with the switch not turning off. The burnout rate is concerning, with multiple customers reporting that their units burned out.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsgood things come in small packages
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2025

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsWork great. Ignore the silly reviews.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: I have used numerous of these switches in various projects, both my own and for clients.  Was hestitant at first despite from of the reviews.  Long short, they work great if you know what you are doing (basic electrical skills and such).I have purchased and installed many of these touch activated switches, from latching (no LED) to latching with LED always on, to stepless dimming (LED on when light on). All have worked from the start and continue to work perfectly. Really great switches.Note that these switches do not interrupt the red (positive) wires as in most mechanical toggle switches, but instead interrupt the black to green connection (negative); in other words, the black and green wire CANNOT share a common ground but must instead remain on separate, isolated circuits (green to battery negative, black to light negative).This is exactly as shown in their installation instructions. However, I tried to take a shortcut with this light as I was swapping out an older, mechanical toggle switch and had wired the light so that its black/negative ground wire was connected to chassis ground, which is also ultimately connected back to my "house" battery ground in my vehicle. The touch switch didn't operate under these conditions (unlike most 12V DC mechanical toggle switches). I have since disconnected the light's ground wire from its connection with chassis ground and connected it directly to the black wire of the touch switch, and viola! All the switches I have utilized work perfectly!I've included the wiring schematic I received.

customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGood switch, just worded wrong.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: After trying to beat this switch to death, I figured it out. Instructions not specific. There are 4 wires coming off the switch. #1-Black wire- goes to battery ground, #2 red wire goes to ignition wire, not battery. #3 red wire goes to lights, #4 yellow wire goes to lights ground wire or wires. It is not an on-off switch. it is only a dimmer switch. On - off requires key on to turn on, and key off to turn off. Hope this helps everyone.

customer_reviews.review_title: 2.0 out of 5 starsRevised 5 to a 2 star rating becayse: Even after getting a disconnected wire on 2nd order,
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    I still like these the best. I have used these for illuminating my custom built power supplies to controlling  12v 1.5 amp fans and more. For two of my projects I had to cut off the heat shrink wrapper (its bulky and fairly useless and replace the wires with highly flexible wires (20 and 22 ga). the one I had to do this because the +out wire was actually disconnected upon arrival which I guess most people would return as a "reject" but I had to re wire it anyway because the wires they provide are very very stiff and hard to route so,  big deal I just replaced them.But the electronics in this "micro" switch is fantastic and user friendly. I plan on using them in other designs too. I highly recommend these. Please see my video before trying to mount.UPDATE:  NOW I jinxed myself singing praise for these but the very next one I used wouldnt shut off.  It was on all the time.  I could adjust the PWM but it wouldnt shut off.  As soon as I powered up it was on and stayed on until I cut power.  Thats a bummer.  The led worked, everything worked I just didnt have the capability ot turn it on/off with the button.  O well I have more but its frustrating to finalize ur project and find such a fundamental flaw.  O well. Rip it apart again.REVISED:  5 TO 2 STAR RATING:I ordered a three pack and all therr blew out (not literally) they just stopped working properly. I know for a fact that these can't handle 2 amps let alone 3. I sent them back.  I guess if ur using 350mA LEDs these work .. that's what I initially  was using them for but as soon as I tried pushin 650mA (and 2 strings of 650mA LEDs)  they just dont work .u can easily tell they r shot because the only thing they do I lit up.  NO PWM , NO ON/OFF NOTHING.  VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED 😞

customer_reviews.rating: 5.0 out of 5 stars5.0 out of 5 stars
customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsIts small and it dims
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet: This little dimmer button is fun. It's biggest problem is making itself know to those who aren't looking for it. It is simply a touch dimmer for 12v, max 36 watt, LED lights. Touch it and it comes on. Hold your touch and it dims up or down, depending on it dimmoing state. If you stop dimming at a point of brightness that you like and turn the light off by touching the button, it will return to that level when you touch the button and turn it back on. It is very small and compact and doesn't cause flicker (when used with the right power supply and lights) and is silent. If you are looking for an unobtrusive small dimmer, this could be your best bet.The photo above shows the switch mounted in a corner oak piece I made to dim under the under-counter lights.

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Installed these in my cargo trailer conversion for the lights 12 vdc. Work great. Love the ability to dim them. Easy to install
